alert.note: Alert for Bracken (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 6:58AM EST until January 03 at 7:30AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Northern Kentucky and Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, in Northern Kentucky, Bracken, Grant, Owen and Pendleton. In Southwest Ohio, Brown and Clermont. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 658 AM EST, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Williamstown, Falmouth, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Owenton, Augusta, Felicity, Butler, Neville, Higginsport, Morgan, Corinth, Moscow, Monterey, Gratz, Chilo, Cherry Grove and Williamstown Lake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
